meanings.definition: A cup or chalice that is believed to have miraculous powers.
meanings.sent1: The grail was said to have magical abilities.
meanings.sent2: The knight embarked on a quest to find the legendary grail.
meanings.sent3: The magician accidentally turned his hat into a grail during the performance.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a grail, bringing joy to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The grail shimmered in the dim candlelight, casting a mystical glow.

meanings.definition: A highly sought-after or coveted object.
meanings.sent1: The rare painting was considered the grail of the art world.
meanings.sent2: For treasure hunters, finding the lost city was the ultimate grail.
meanings.sent3: The grail of the auction was a vintage car that belonged to a famous actor.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was his grail, cherished above all else.
meanings.sent5: In the world of fashion, the designer bag was the holy grail of accessories.

meanings.definition: A goal or quest that is difficult to achieve.
meanings.sent1: Becoming a doctor was her lifelong grail.
meanings.sent2: The grail of winning the championship motivated the team to train harder.
meanings.sent3: His grail of learning to play the piano like a pro seemed impossible at first.
meanings.sent4: Overcoming his fear of heights became his personal grail.
meanings.sent5: The grail of climbing Mount Everest pushed him to conquer his fears.
